oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: This Little Light of Mine Programs: C. L. Franklin: Gospel Preacher - Sweet Honey in the Rock: New Songs From An Old Tradition
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of two segments of This Little Light of Mine. This Little Light of Mine is a show that provides introspection to the main influencers of African-American gospel. The first segment is hosted by Bobby Jones (host). The first segment reflects on the life of C. L. Franklin (singer/songwriter), and is called "C. L. Franklin: Gospel Preacher." The second segment is hosted by an unidentified host and features testimony by Sweet Honey in the Rock member, Bernice Johnson-Reagon. The second segment is called, "Sweet Honey in the Rock: New Songs From An Old Tradition." The recordings are from unidentified dates.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bobby Jones; C. L. Franklin; Sweet Honey in the Rock
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) This Little Light of Mine [featuring Bobby Jones voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:31) C. L. Franklin performs for his congregation as Bobby Jones describes Reverend Franklin's story -- (03:29) Jones introduces Reverend Franklin and Jeff Titan -- (03:39) Franklin reflects on how his father was unable to read while purchasing groceries -- (05:41) Jones introduces Racheal Franklin's take on Franklin's different nature -- (06:49) Franklin reflects on being converted -- (07:44) Jones reflects on how Franklin molded Aretha Franklin -- (08:09) I Love the Lord (He Heard My Cry) (C. L. Franklin) -- (09:41) Jones introduces Racheal Franklin's recollection of how C. L. Franklin came to the understanding that he would become a preacher -- (10:57) Jones discusses Franklin's prodigy status and Franklin's family -- (12:31) C. L. Franklin discusses his understanding of preaching -- (14:33) Franklin performs a sermon about Saint Mary -- (15:38) Jones addresses how C. L. Franklin was signed to Battle Records to record his live sermons -- (16:11) C. L. Franklin recalls the financial stress of performing with the Clara Ward singers -- (20:25) Jones reflects on Franklin's celebrity status and Aretha Franklin's first national exposure -- (21:28) Jeff Titan discusses meeting Franklin and the interview he performed -- (22:18) C. L. Franklin performs a sermon -- (23:08) This Little Light of Mine [featuring Bobby Jones outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (24:32) This Little Light of Mine [featuring unidentified host introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (25:10) Sweet Honey in the Rock (Unconfirmed) [featuring unidentified host voiceover] (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (25:56) The unidentified voice introduces Sweet Honey in the Rock; additionally, Bernice Johnson-Reagon reflects on how sacred songs keep the group alive -- (27:41) What is a Babylon (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (31:29) Johnson-Reagon reflects on the contributions of the various members of Sweet Honey in the Rock -- (33:25) Jesus is My Only Friend (Unconfirmed)(Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (35:12) Johnson-Reagon reflects on the traditions of the church at which Sweet Honey in the Rock performed -- (35:56) They Are Falling All Around Me (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (38:12) Johnson-Reagon reflects on how Aisha Kahlil has progressed over time -- (38:48) Unidentified tune (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (39:35) Johnson Reagon praises Kahlil's versatility -- (39:49) Feel Something Drawing Me on (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (42:47) Johnson-Reagon praises Yasmeen Williams -- (43:39) In the Upper Room [featuring Johnson-Reagon discussion of Ysaye Barnwell] (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (45:46) Father I Stretch My Hands to Thee (Sweet Honey in the Rock) -- (46:44) Johnson-Reagon reflects on the wide range of 'song forms' Sweet Honey in the Rock perform -- (49:50) This Little Light of Mine [featuring unidentified host outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jones, Bobby; Franklin, C. L. (Clarence LaVaughn), 1915-1984; Sweet Honey in the Rock (Musical group);
